Sentencas: In the solid oxide fuel cell field, heterogeneous ion doping is a common methodology to improve the ionic conductivity of electrolytes, but overwhelming grain boundary resistance is still the main obstacle for low-temperature applications.
Titulo: Improving Grain Boundary Conductivity of Ce0.9Gd0.1O2-δ Electrolyte through Compositing with Carbonate or Semiconductor

Sentencas: According to previous reports, building rapid ion transport at the grain boundary through compositing methods was considered as a proposed design for electrolytes to decrease the grain boundary resistance and obtain high ionic conductivity.
Titulo: Improving Grain Boundary Conductivity of Ce0.9Gd0.1O2-δ Electrolyte through Compositing with Carbonate or Semiconductor

Sentencas: The grain boundary conductivity (sigma(b)) is delicately separated from the EIS results, demonstrating that the sigma(b)of GDC-NBSCu and GDC-Na(2)CO(3)composite are both substantially higher than that of pure GDC.

Sentencas: Therefore, the power density maximum of GDC-NBSCu and GDC-Na(2)CO(3)electrolyte is 726 mW cm(-2)at 600 degrees C and 797 mW cm(-2)at 575 degrees C, respectively.
